bugs.title: CVE-2023-28329 moodle: Authenticated SQL injection via availability check [fedora-all]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2023-28329 moodle: Authenticated SQL injection via availability check [fedora-all]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2023-28329 moodle: Authenticated SQL injection via availability check

long_desc.thetext:
Insufficient validation of profile field availability condition resulted in an SQL injection risk (by default only available to teachers and managers). This flaw affects Moodle versions 4.1 to 4.1.1, 4.0 to 4.0.6, 3.11 to 3.11.12, 3.9 to 3.9.19 and earlier unsupported versions.

Reference:
https://moodle.org/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=445061

Created moodle tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: epel-7 [bug 2180073]
Affects: fedora-all [bug 2180072]

This CVE Bugzilla entry is for community support informational purposes only as it does not affect a package in a commercially supported Red Hat product. Refer to the dependent bugs for status of those individual community products.

More information about this security flaw is available in the following bug:

http://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=2179406

Disclaimer: Community trackers are created by Red Hat Product Security team on a best effort basis. Package maintainers are required to ascertain if the flaw indeed affects their package, before starting the update process.

Use the following template to for the 'fedpkg update' request to submit an
update for this issue as it contains the top-level parent bug(s) as well as
this tracking bug.  This will ensure that all associated bugs get updated
when new packages are pushed to stable.

=====

type=security

# low, medium, high, urgent (required)
severity=high

# testing, stable
request=testing

# Description of your update
notes=Security fix for [PUT CVEs HERE]

# Enable request automation based on the stable/unstable karma thresholds
autokarma=True
stable_karma=3
unstable_karma=-3

bugs.title: CVE-2023-28330 moodle: Authenticated arbitrary file read through malformed backup file [fedora-all]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2023-28330 moodle: Authenticated arbitrary file read through malformed backup file [fedora-all]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2023-28330 moodle: Authenticated arbitrary file read through malformed backup file

long_desc.thetext:
Insufficient sanitizing in backup resulted in an arbitrary file read risk. The capability to access this feature is only available to teachers, managers and admins by default. This flaw affects Moodle versions 4.1 to 4.1.1, 4.0 to 4.0.6, 3.11 to 3.11.12, 3.9 to 3.9.19 and earlier unsupported versions.

Reference:
https://moodle.org/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=445062

bugs.title: CVE-2023-28331 moodle: XSS risk when outputting database activity filter data [fedora-all]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2023-28331 moodle: XSS risk when outputting database activity filter data [fedora-all]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2023-28331 moodle: XSS risk when outputting database activity filter data

long_desc.thetext:
Content output by the database auto-linking filter required additional sanitizing to prevent an XSS risk. This flaw affects Moodle versions 4.1 to 4.1.1, 4.0 to 4.0.6, 3.11 to 3.11.12, 3.9 to 3.9.19 and earlier unsupported versions.

Reference:
https://moodle.org/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=445063

bugs.title: CVE-2023-28332 moodle: Algebra filter XSS when filter is misconfigured [fedora-all]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2023-28332 moodle: Algebra filter XSS when filter is misconfigured [fedora-all]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2023-28332 moodle: Algebra filter XSS when filter is misconfigured

long_desc.thetext:
If the algebra filter was enabled but not functional (eg the necessary binaries were missing from the server), it presented an XSS risk. This flaw affects Moodle versions 4.1 to 4.1.1, 4.0 to 4.0.6, 3.11 to 3.11.12, 3.9 to 3.9.19 and earlier unsupported versions.

Reference:
https://moodle.org/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=445064

bugs.title: CVE-2023-28333 moodle: Pix helper potential Mustache code injection risk [fedora-all]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2023-28333 moodle: Pix helper potential Mustache code injection risk [fedora-all]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2023-28333 moodle: Pix helper potential Mustache code injection risk

long_desc.thetext:
The Mustache pix helper contained a potential Mustache injection risk if combined with user input (note: This did not appear to be implemented/exploitable anywhere in the core Moodle LMS). This flaw affects Moodle versions 4.1 to 4.1.1, 4.0 to 4.0.6, 3.11 to 3.11.12, 3.9 to 3.9.19 and earlier unsupported versions.

Reference:
https://moodle.org/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=445065

bugs.title: CVE-2023-28336 moodle: Teacher can access names of users they do not have permission to access [fedora-all]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2023-28336 moodle: Teacher can access names of users they do not have permission to access [fedora-all]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2023-28336 moodle: Teacher can access names of users they do not have permission to access

long_desc.thetext:
Insufficient filtering of grade report history made it possible for teachers to access the names of users they could not otherwise access. This flaw affects Moodle versions 4.1 to 4.1.1, 4.0 to 4.0.6, 3.11 to 3.11.12, 3.9 to 3.9.19 and earlier unsupported versions.

Reference:
https://moodle.org/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=445068

Created moodle tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: epel-7 [bug 2180093]
Affects: fedora-all [bug 2180092]

This CVE Bugzilla entry is for community support informational purposes only as it does not affect a package in a commercially supported Red Hat product. Refer to the dependent bugs for status of those individual community products.

We have also encountered this in our work this academic year. Therefore, for now, we were forced to suspend the application as well as related services and the library. At the moment, students use https://edubirdie.com/write-my-thesis as a third-party source of information. They provide data for research in a wide range of academic topics. But this is currently used as a temporary measure. Please tell me if there is any solution to this problem?

More information about this security flaw is available in the following bug:

http://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=2179426

Disclaimer: Community trackers are created by Red Hat Product Security team on a best effort basis. Package maintainers are required to ascertain if the flaw indeed affects their package, before starting the update process.

bugs.title: CVE-2023-1402 moodle: Course participation report shows roles the user should not see [fedora-all]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2023-1402 moodle: Course participation report shows roles the user should not see [fedora-all]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2023-1402 moodle: Course participation report shows roles the user should not see

long_desc.thetext:
The course participation report required additional checks to prevent roles being displayed which the user did not have access to view. This flaw affects Moodle versions 4.1 to 4.1.1, 4.0 to 4.0.6, 3.11 to 3.11.12, 3.9 to 3.9.19 and earlier unsupported versions.

Reference:
https://moodle.org/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=445069

Created moodle tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: epel-7 [bug 2180099]
Affects: fedora-all [bug 2180098]

This CVE Bugzilla entry is for community support informational purposes only as it does not affect a package in a commercially supported Red Hat product. Refer to the dependent bugs for status of those individual community products.
thanks for solution

It's reassuring to know that it doesn't impact commercially supported Red Hat products and is intended for community informational purposes.
